title: Otolaryngology Surgical Education: Online Video-Based Simulation Training

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic medical terminology and anatomy, experience with VR device usage
context.additional_context: An otolaryngology surgery training course for pre-service/in-service teachers at vocational institutions, supplementing practical opportunities by combining VR simulations and YouTube video learning, with continuous monitoring of learning outcomes via formative assessments.

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain the key steps of Type 1 myringoplasty and tympanic membrane patching with 80% accuracy.
Learners will successfully perform surgical tool manipulation and patient positioning three or more times in a VR simulation environment.
Learners will be able to analyze the quality of surgical video education on a 4-point scale (1â€“4) using the LAP-VEGaS evaluation criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
